info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:30PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Churchill and northern Lyon Counties through 830 PM PDT... At 727 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Hazen, or 11 miles northwest of Fallon, moving north at 20 mph. This storm is moving towards I-80 west of Trinity Junction. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Blowing dust may reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Hazen, Trinity Junction, Desert Peak and Junction I 80 And U.S 95 (exit 83). MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
